intro: Sphaerocephalus humilis, commonly known as the dwarf sphaerocephalus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in tight, spherical inflorescences, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
